title: The Scalar Potential in Noncommutative Geometry
abstract: We present a derivation of the general form of the scalar potential in Yang-Mills theory of a non-commutative space which is a product of a four-dimensional manifold times a discrete set of points. We show that a non-trivial potential without flat directions is obtained after eliminating the auxiliary fields only if constraints are imposed on the mass matrices utilised in the Dirac operator. The constraints and potential are related to a prepotential function.
